bio: Ami Vitale is a @natgeo photographer, filmmaker, speaker and @nikonusa ambassador. New book- Panda Love: the secret life of pandas

list.comment:
Photo by @amivitale. To celebrate the holiday season, I am offering a special package to bring panda joy into the lives of your friends, family and yourself. For just $125 plus shipping, you will receive signed 7.5 x 7.5 inch fine-art print of Yeye in the Mist AND an autographed copy of my book Panda Love: The Secret Life of Pandas. Hurry, this special is only available until Dec. 3 to insure a Dec. 24 delivery.

Are you looking for a larger print of Yeye in the Mist? It’s also available on my website until Dec. 31. Every Yeye print will come with your very owned signed copy of Panda Love. All photographs are printed by the fine art studio of Paper & Ink (@paperandinkstudio ) on archival paper which is designed to meet museum longevity requirements. Link is in the bio.
Panda Love is a collection of images of these gentle giants on location in China. It captures the inspiring efforts to breed pandas and release them back into the wild. Fluffy panda cubs tumble out of baskets and play hide-and-seek with their carers, while the adult pandas curiously explore the forest and climb trees. China may be on its way to successfully saving its most famous ambassador, and "Panda Love" documents the process of putting the wild back into an icon.

@natgeo @natgeoimagecollection @thephotosociety @nikonusa

#sichuan #china #climatechange #conservation #savetheplanet #panda #pandas #babypanda #ipanda #giantpanda #pandacub #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassador #photojournalism #amivitale #cuteanimals

Photo by @amivitale. Happy Thanksgiving! I'm thankful for my many incredible friends, family, the individuals and organizations who work year-round to protect our wildlife, like keeper Mary Lengees, who cares for orphaned elephants at Reteti Elephant Sanctuary (@r.e.s.c.u.e). Reteti is the first indigenous-owned and run elephant sanctuary in northern Kenya. Mary is one of the first indigenous Samburu women elephant keepers in all of Africa. The sanctuary is helping to change the lives of the people in the community as well as the animals under their care.

Follow these and other wonderful organizations from around the world to support and learn more about these initiatives. @r.e.s.c.u.e, @nrt_kenya, @lewa_wildlife, @conservationorg, @tusk_org, @kenyawildlifeservice, @sandiegozoo, @nature_africa.#goodtoearth @lavazzaofficial

@natgeo, @natgeoimagecollection, @thephotosociety, @nikonusa,
#DontLetThemDisappear #elephant #saveelephants #retetielephants #stoppoaching #kenya #northernkenya #magicalkenya #whyilovekenya #africa #everydayafrica #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonnofilter #nikonambassadors #photojournalism #amivitale

Photo by @amivitale. Najin, on the right, is one of the last Northern white rhinos left on the planet. Her very protective best friend, left, is a Southern white rhino. Najin lives at Kenya’s Ol Pejeta Conservancy (@olpejeta) under 24-hour protection by armed guards. March 19th, 2018, Sudan, the world’s last male northern white rhino passed away at @olpejeta. These majestic creatures have been poached into near extinction, but indigenous communities and dedicated keepers are hard at work to bring them back. By supporting and visiting these communities, we can help protect these magnificent animals. @nrt_kenya @tusk_org @kenyawildlifeservice @thephotosociety @natgeo @nature_org @nikonusa @nature_africa @synology.official #WorthMoreAlive #protectrhinos #SudanForever #OlPejetaRhinos #NorthernWhiteRhinos #DontLetThemDisappear #rhinos #saverhinos #stoppoaching #kenya #northernkenya #magicalkenya #africa #everydayafrica #worldrhinoday #photojournalism #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonambassadors #amivitale

Photo by @amivitale | A Nepali woman carries wheat back to her village in Rukum District. In South Asia, women make up 70% of the agricultural workforce, yet like nearly all women worldwide, they face obstacles to reaching their full potential. Just 13% of agricultural landowners in the world women; women do not have the same access to loans as men, they lack knowledge of and access to technology, and there is a dearth of childcare options. According to the @UN, if women farmers has the same access as resources as men, they could increase yields on their farms by 20-30%. To learn more about the lives of women worldwide and the vital roles they play in their communities, follow @amivitale.

@natgeo @thephotosociety @natgeoimagecollection #agriculture #women #wheat #food #foodsecurity #empoweringwomen #beautiful #nepal #southasia #everydayasia #amivitale

Excited to share books by some of my favorite photographers this week.

Pete Souza’s (@petesouza) new book Shade is a portrait in contrasts, juxtaposing his unforgettable images of President Obama against tweets, headlines and quotes from the Trump White House. His work highlights the power and chaos that have come to define American politics.
This week I’m sharing recommendations for books from photographers I love that would make wonderful gifts this holiday season. Please join me in supporting these committed photographers! Head to @petesouza profile to pick up a copy of his fantastic books. #petesouza #whitehouse #photojournalism

Photo by @amivitale. I met Nolkidotu right after all of his family’s wealth was lost in one night, when a pride of lions killed his cow in Naitiroki village in lower Loita, Kenya. It was a huge blow to the health of his family. Cases of human-wildlife conflict are common, and both sides suffer the consequences. Frequent meetings are held with farmers and pastoralists in the area, where wildlife movements can be shared and discussed, as can ways to mitigate risk, and what to do should an incident occur. These issues highlight the huge importance of communities and rangers working together to ensure the safety and livelihoods of both people and wildlife.

I'm honored to take over WWF-UK's (@wwf_uk) account this week during the London Conference on Illegal Wildlife Trade. The Conference is an opportunity for global leaders to come together and make commitments to help end illegal wildlife trade. This year’s conference will focus on three key themes; tackling the Illegal Wildlife Trade as a serious organised crime, building coalitions and closing markets.

Follow @wwf_uk to learn more about their efforts to create solutions to the most serious conservation challenges facing our planet, helping people and nature to thrive. Find out more and help #EndWildlifeCrime by signing their petition to stop illegal wildlife trade at wwf.org.uk.
#wildlifephotography #conservation #nature #EndWildlifeCrime #worthmorealive #everydayafrica #kenya #AmiVitale #africa #photojournalism #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonambassadors @thephotosociety @natgeo @nikonusa @synology.official #conservation

Paula Bronstein’s book (@pbbphoto) ‘Afghanistan: Between Hope and Fear’ presents a stunning portrait of the war-torn country's people across more than a decade. Paula’s work gives voice to those Afghans, particularly women and children, documenting everything from the grave trials facing the country to the stirrings of new hope.

This week I’m sharing recommendations for books from photographers I love that would make wonderful gifts this holiday season. Please join me in supporting these committed photographers!
#photojournalism #afghanistan

I'm honored to be speaking at the @WorldPressPhoto 2018 Exhibition Opening in Washington, DC, tomorrow, Oct. 26! The opening is organized by @lightscapedc and runs from 6.30-10pm and will feature some incredible talks and award-winning work. A limited number of tickets are still available. (Link in profile.) Hope to see you there!

Photo by @amivitale. Villagers of Zigberi, Burkina Faso collect water from the only pump well that offers clean water for miles. Zigberi lies in the desert region near the Malian border. Water is precious commodity here, and most families end up drinking dirty water rather than walk the miles it takes to get to the well.
This week I’m sharing images of women in Africa, exploring their lives and the vital roles they play in their communities.

@rippleeffectimages @natgeo @natgeoimagecollection @thephotosociety @oxfamGB @oxfamamerica @nikonusa #BurkinaFaso #water #freshwater #nature #conservation #everydayafrica #africa #tanzania #nikonnofilter #nofilter #nikon #nikonambassadors #amivitale #photojournalism

Photo by @amivitale. I'm proud to be a part of @RippleEffectImages and excited to be celebrating Day of the Girl with them this week. By creating stories and films for fabulous aid organizations that change the lives of women and girls, we've helped our aid partners raise over $10 million. Girls are the answer and the promise of tomorrow. As rains come and seas rise, as temperatures climb and wells dry, girls will find the solutions to keep families afloat, and children safe. Their bravery and spirit will ensure survival at this time of dramatic changes in the world. Ripple Effect Images works with the aid organizations who empower these girls with education, health care, resources and economic possibilities. Learn more, including how to get involved, by following @rippleeffectimages.

#women #girls #empowerment #aid #ngo #inspiration #internationaldayofthegirl #dayofthegirl #photojournalism #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonambassadors #amivitale

Photo by @brybit . I was honored to visit six countries this summer to tell powerful stories of communities and individuals protecting our planet for the 2019 Lavazza Calendar, titled #GoodToEarth. The @LavazzaOfficial project will, through photography and art, show us stories where even in the most challenging places, there is beauty, resilience and hope. Stay tuned for the official unveil on November 21st in Turin, Italy and join me on this epic journey to Kenya, Colombia, Morocco, Switzerland, Belgium and Thailand.
@thephotosociety @natgeo @nikonusa @natgeoimagecollection #photojournalism #conservation #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonambassador #amivitale #Kenya, #Colombia, #Morocco, #Switzerland, #Belgium and #Thailand.

Photo by @amivitale. So excited to be speaking at the @WorldPressPhoto 2018 Exhibition Opening in Washington, DC exhibition opening next Friday, Oct. 26 at the Dupont Underground. Organized by @lightscapedc, the opening runs from 6.30-10pm and will feature talks by three 2018 @WorldPressPhoto winners and show the 2018 winning work, a retrospective of Photo of the Year from 1955, the honorees of the @iwmf's Anja Niedringhaus Award, photos from four African Photojournalism Database photographers, and more. Do come out for this incredible affair. Tickets available by clicking on the link in my profile.

Here, Naitemu Letur pushes a jug of water back to her manyatta. "Before, we would walk for hours every day just to get water,” she says. “Sometimes it was not safe but now we have plenty of water near our homes and this has made our lives more secure." The Northern Rangelands Trust in Northern Kenya (@nrt_kenya) is a group of community conservancies with a self-sustaining proposition—financially and socially—by providing water, health care, education and jobs for the local community through responsible tourism and complementary agro-pastoralism. This makes the community deeply invested in the effort’s success. In earlier conservation efforts, threatened forests and endangered species were protected by uniformed guards. Here, they are protected by women and school children, who have a vested interest in a healthy environment because they benefit directly. Rather than something that has to be guarded from local communities, the environment becomes a source of sustainable economic activity for those communities.

This week I’m sharing images of women in Africa, exploring their lives and the vital roles they play in their communities.

@nature_africa @nature_org @thephotosociety @natgeo @natgeoimagecollection @nikonusa @magicalkenya #kenya #magicalkenya #northernkenya #whyilovekenya #conservation #womeninconservation #africa #everydayafrica #photojournalism #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonambassador #amivitale

Photo by @amivitale. In December 2009, I heard about a plan to airlift four of the last Northern White Rhinos from @safari_park_dvur_kralove in the Czech Republic back to Africa. It sounded like a storyline for a Disney film but in reality, it was a desperate, last ditch effort to save an entire species. The hope was to breed them. The air, water, and food, not to mention room to roam, might stimulate them to breed—and the offspring would then be used to repopulate Africa.
Back then, there were only eight of these gentle, hulking creatures alive, all in zoos. Today there are two, both in Kenya at Ol Pejeta Conservancy (@olpejeta). March 19th, Sudan, the last living male Northern White Rhino passed away. If there is any meaning in his death, its that Sudan can be our final wake up call. In a world of 7 billion, we need to start recognizing that we are not separate from nature. When we see ourselves as part of the landscape and part of nature, then saving nature is really about saving ourselves.

In honor of World Rhino Day on Sept. 22, I am sharing some of my favorite images of these magnificent, ancient creatures. Together we can work to save them - visit and support the communities that protect them.

Photo by @amivitale. Thrilled & honored to be speaking alongside two of my idols, Carol Guzy (@carolguzy) and Lynsey Addario (@lynseyaddario), at Photo Plus Expo (@photoplusexpo) for @nikonusa next week in NYC on Oct. 25. Women collect water at sunset in Usuru, Tanzania. Women in developing countries carry an enormous burden. When water becomes scarce, it is women who walk extra hours each day in search of enough for their families to survive.
This week I’m sharing images of women in Africa, exploring their lives and the vital roles they play in their communities.

Photo by @amivitale. Ntipiyon Nonguta and her son Bernard, 1, relax with their neighbors as they make beaded belts for Loisaba Community Trust in Ewaso Village in Laikipia, Kenya. These women are in a community surrounding Loisaba Conservancy (@loisaba_conservancy) and are being supported and given access to international markets. Revenue from ecotourism is reinvested into neighboring communities like #Ewaso.

This week I’m sharing images of women in Africa, exploring their lives and the vital roles they play in their communities.

Excited to share books by some of my favorite photographers this week.@cristinamittermeier’s new, limited-edition book Amaze showcases her staggering nature photography and is a must-have book for all those who care about our planet and those we share it with.

This week I’m sharing recommendations for books from photographers I love that would make wonderful gifts this holiday season. Please join me in supporting these amazing photographers!
#photojournalism #photography #naturephotography #savetheplanet #africa #asia #southasia #amaze

Pete McBride’s (@pedromcbride) brand new book The Grand Canyon - Between River and Rim, chronicles Pete McBride and Kevin Fedarko's (@kevinfedarkoauthor) journey hiking the entire length of Grand Canyon National Park. Their gorgeous work highlights the challenges our national parks are facing as increased development pressures are poised to change the Canyon’s iconic landscape.

This week I’m sharing recommendations for books from photographers I love that would make wonderful gifts this holiday season. Please join me in supporting these committed photographers! Head to @pedromcbride profile to pick up a copy of his fantastic books.

#photojournalism #photography #petemcbride #grandcanyon #landscape #nature

Excited to be taking part in the launch of @lavazzaofficial’s 2019 Calendar, a collection of projects from around the world working to protect and preserve our planet. Follow the live event coverage tonight from 6.30pm CET on Lavazza's Twitter (@Lavazza) to discover all the #GoodtoEarth activities.

Congratulations to my dear friend, veterinarian Pete Morkel, shown here with one of the last northern white rhinos back in 2009 at @safari_park_dvur_kralove in the #CzechRepublic before they were brought to @olpejeta conservancy in Kenya. Pete won the Prince William Award for Conservation in Africa, 2018 last week given by @tusk_org. I've known Pete for almost 10 years and the man is one of my greatest inspirations. He has committed his entire life to saving wildlife all over this planet and “shown complete disregard for his personal safety, whilst spending many months at a time away from his family dedicating his entire energy and attention to the conservation and welfare of Africa’s wildlife." The Telegraph writes, “You’re always taking a few blows here and there,” he laughs. He works in some of the world’s least stable countries, in areas infested by armed poachers or rebel groups like the Lord’s Resistance Army or uncleared mines. He once fractured his skull when his Cessna crashed. He reckons he has immobilised 10,000 animals. Inevitably a few have died. “Success and failure are just a heartbeat away from each other,” he says. “It can be gutting. I’ve had my share of failure and you just have to pick up and keep going and learn from what went wrong.” #gratitude #tuskawards #tusktrust #conservation #africa

Excited to share books by some of my favorite photographers this week. @lynseyaddario’s beautiful new photo book ‘Of Love & War’ with Penguin Press features a curated selection of work from the past 20 years of her career, with over two hundred images from the Middle East, South Asia and Africa.
This week I’m sharing recommendations for books from photographers I love that would make wonderful gifts this holiday season. Please join me in supporting these amazing photographers!
#photojournalism #photography #naturephotography #savetheplanet #lynseyaddario #africa #asia #southasia #ofloveandwar

I’m honored to announce that I’m the photographer of 2019 Lavazza Calendar, titled “Good to Earth.” @lavazzaofficial #GoodToEarth. Stay tuned to learn more! Since its launch 26 years ago, the world's top photographers have shot it, including Helmut Newton, David LaChapelle, Steve McCurry and Annie Leibovitz, among others. I am humbled and overwhelmed with gratitude to follow in their footsteps. The calendar launches on November 21st in Turin, Italy, and it is my sincere hope you find it enriching and inspiring. The concept this year is to use our collective creativity to be good to this one precious planet of ours.
@thephotosociety @natgeo @nikonusa @natgeoimagecollection #photojournalism #conservation #nikonusa #nikonlove #nikonambassador #amivitale

Photo by @amivitale. I’m excited to be sharing some of my work from Kenya on the @unicef_kenya Instagram account in celebration of World Children’s Day on November 20th.

Students at Ewaso Primary School in Ewaso village, in Laikipia North in northern Kenya, skype with individuals from The Nature Conservancy (@nature_africa) as they learn about the importance of conservation in the region. Local communities are the best protectors of these landscapes, and as these children grow up alongside Loisaba Conservancy (@loisaba_conservancy), they will be the best immunization against forces that threaten both their wildlife and their way of life.

Follow @unicef_kenya, @loisaba_conservancy and @nature_africa to learn more about the incredible people and organizations who are working to strengthen the communities in their midst.

@nature_org #kenya #magicalkenya #whyilovekenya #northernkenya #africa #children #education #school #conservation #photojournalism #amivitale
